text: a poor widow who had brought up her only child so well that the little lass was more helpful and handy than many a grown - up person . When other women 's children
The slatternly mothers , who spoiled and scolded their children by turns , and had never taught them to be tidy and obedient , used often to quote the widow 's little girl to their troublesome brats
the helpless , useless , untidy little girls
the little girls who had a spite against her
all children who strayed near their dwelling
the little girl , who now darned away as skilfully as ever
all the men of the place
